titleStmt.title: By the King a proclamation for the new making, altering, amending, dressing, repairing, proouing, and stamping of armours, gunnes, pikes, and bandaliers, both of the common armes, and armes of the trayned band throughout England and Wales.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

titleStmt.title: By the King a proclamation for the new making, altering, amending, dressing, repairing, proouing, and stamping of armours, gunnes, pikes, and bandaliers, both of the common armes, and armes of the trayned band throughout England and Wales.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie: and by the Assignes of Iohn Bill,

notesStmt.note: The London Company of Workmen-Armourers to oversee all army and county weapons.
"Giuen at Our Court at Greenwich, The thirtieth day of Iune, in the seuenth yeere of Our Reigne."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.

person.persName: the Kings most Excellent Maiestie: and

orgName.name: Worshipful Company of Armourers and Brasiers in the City of London.
